Position Summary

The Clinical Data Integration Analyst (the “IA”) is responsible for using data tools to perform the tasks of mapping, harmonizing, and ‘enhancing’ data from a customer source system, such as the EMR. The IA collaborates with the client's technical staff to determine the best and most practical way to meet the data requirements of products. The IA works with partners to transform data and populate a production environment with the required specifications (e.g. FHIR standard).

The IA will be involved during the deployment phase with the primary workstream of mapping healthcare EHR data to standard HL7 FHIR schemas. Once the customer is live, IAs may spend 10-20% of their time performing maintenance activities on all deployed customer mappings. Maintenance activities can include changing or updating mapping logic based on user feedback, data quality issues, or new product requirements. The analyst may also need to perform

technical tasks related to managing changes in our data stream that result from client EMR upgrades.

Role Responsibilities:

Performing actual mapping tasks using SQL-based configuration and hierarchical, layered transformation of source schema to meet target output schema specifications as defined by HL7 FHIR and product specifications.
Leveraging knowledge of common EHR schemas and datasets to determine the optimal mapping logic and design for long-term viability and maintenance.
Strategizing with client IT personnel on the most practical methods to meet the data requirements for a given data source.
Analyzing samples of actual client data to evaluate data quality and availability. Understanding and documenting the client-side EHR workflow and its implications on the data we map from.
Performing comprehensive data validation and troubleshooting data issues through problem-solving with internal and external stakeholders.
Clearly documenting all assumptions and important steps during the mapping process and tracking the progress towards completion of the spec.
Providing ongoing feedback to product and engineering teams on internal tool development.
Training and onboarding clients and partners on mapping activities and workflows.

Role Requirements:

Bachelor’s degree in Healthcare Information Management Systems, Health Informatics, Information Technology, or any other relevant field.
Clinical experience (e.g., a Nurse Informaticist) as a plus
2- 4 years of significant experience with a SQL based query language and a strong understanding of relational databases as well as ETL related activities.
2-4 years of significant experience working with common data transformation tasks and strong familiarity with a data pipeline and data transfer mechanisms, particularly healthcare-specific methods (e.g. HL7v2, FHIR, Dicom, ETL)
Significant depth/experience in one or more EMRs (e.g. Epic Clarity, Cerner, Meditech) and comfort with common healthcare ontologies (ICD-10, LOINC, SNOMED, etc.)
Experience in health IT, ideally working in an interoperability-related role at a health system, EMR or vendor.

About the Department of Pathology:

Comprised of extraordinary faculty and staff, our mission is to improve the ability to diagnose, treat and understand the origin and manifestation of human disease, and to care for those who have or are at risk to develop disease. We accomplish this through our clinical services (in all fields of anatomic and clinical pathology, including molecular and genomic pathology, histocompatibility testing and transfusion medicine) and be research (which includes basic, translational and clinical research into the origins and manifestations of disease, including efforts to improve disease prediction and prevention as part of the goal of achieving precision medicine and health), and also by educating future leaders in pathology and related fields. Everything we do is to achieve the goals of providing the highest quality of clinical services to the patients for whom we passionately care, to advance our ability to understand, diagnose, monitor and ultimately to cure disease or to prevent or delay its occurrence, and to provide outstanding education and career development opportunities to those who share these goals.

About the Lab:

The goal of Dr. Brooke Howitt’s lab is to better understand molecular features of tumors that better inform:

Diagnostic classification
Identification of diagnostic, prognostic, and predictive biomarkers
Our understanding of the complex biology underlying initiation and progression of diseases, leading to improved detection, prevention, and treatment approaches
Spatial and single cell studies compatible with archival FFPE tissues

We have focused on gynecologic and sarcoma entities, with ongoing projects on:

Uterine carcinosarcoma
Uterine sarcomas and mesenchymal tumors
Endometrial carcinomas including rare variants such as mesonephric-like carcinoma

Collect, manage and clean datasets.

Use system reports and analyses to identify potentially problematic data, make corrections, and determine root cause for data problems from input errors or inadequate field edits, and suggest possible solutions.

our analytical insights and attention to detail will contribute to the alignment of our systems with industry best practices.

Job Title: Personnel Analyst II (Extra Help - Police Recruiter)
Job Description:
JOB
Are you interested in making a difference in the Vallejo Community? The City of Vallejo is currently seeking highly qualified individuals to fill two extra help Police Recruiter positions within the Human Resources Department. Extra help positions are temporary, at-will in nature, and are not part of the classified civil service. As such, employees in extra help positions do not have property rights to permanently allocated positions and are not eligible for promotional opportunities open to regular part-time and full-time employees. The intent of extra help positions is to assist departments in fulfilling temporary influxes of extra work that cannot be met by regular staff. ABOUT THE POSITIONSIndividuals in these extra help positions, will assist in the execution of the Vallejo Police Department's recruitment efforts including: actively seeking potential candidates through various channels such as job fairs, social media marketing, and community outreach; providing information and guidance on the selection process for those who are interested in making law enforcement a career; and promoting diversity by encouraging individuals from underrepresented groups to apply.Individuals in these positions will be expected to develop and execute strategies to increase brand awareness and job posting engagement, track data and results related to individual recruiting efforts, and travel to networking events. WHO SHOULD APPLYThe ideal candidates for these positions are individuals with prior law enforcement recruitment experience. They will possess the ability to execute recruiting strategy, candidate management, diversity sourcing, and the knowledge of law enforcement recruiting best practices and processes. They will be familiar with data tracking methods and will be knowledgeable in law enforcement hiring trends. The ideal candidates should also be familiar with community policing principles and encourage the recruitment of officers who understand the community policing philosophy of systematic use of partnerships and problem-solving techniques to proactively address the immediate conditions that give rise to public safety issues such as crime, social disorder, and fear of crime. ABOUT THE TEAMThese positions will report to the Human Resources Director but will work collaboratively with the Human Resources Department and the Vallejo Police Department. The Vallejo Police Department's mission is to provide professional law enforcement services that enhance, protect, and promote the quality of life for persons residing, visiting, or doing business in the City of Vallejo. ABOUT THE CITYThe City of Vallejo is located in Solano County and has a population of approximately 121,000 residents. Vallejo is a rapidly changing, highly diverse community located midway between the cities of San Francisco and Sacramento. It is a friendly, active waterfront community that attracts innovative, hardworking people and takes great pride in its 148-year history and maritime heritage. Residents of Vallejo are situated to take advantage of the best of what the area has to offer. Golf, museums, performing arts, boutique shopping, brewpubs and a wide selection of restaurants are all available in Vallejo. Residents and visitors alike enjoy Vallejo's delightful historical downtown area, weekly downtown farmer's market, and beautifully restored Victorian homes and business facades. Vallejo is also home to Six Flags Discovery Kingdom, one of America's only combination wildlife, oceanarium and theme parks.
